rComments: He always had an abundant amount of material to present every class session and went through it too fast. However, if you read and go to section, you'll have no problem passing. I literally fell asleep during every class session (because it was an 8 AM) and I managed to get an A.

Mester was a G for Intro to Linguistics at 8 in the morning. He's a bit goofy and understanding and the class was easy if you went to lecture and section (which was like three times all quarter) I would definitely recommend anyone to take a class with him and i would again.

Armin is a great professor and a wonderful human being. He's super passionate about his subject and expects a decent amount of time on your part. The amount of effort he expects for Phono 1 is totally reasonable and the material is clear if you just pay attention and commit to it. Sit in the front, review the material periodically and you're good.
Terrible class, interesting subject. He went way too fast and wasn't clear with material

He is really passionate about what he teaches and it shows. He goes through the slides super quickly, but I don't know why people are so mad about that, HE HAS A LOT TO COVER IN 70 MINUTES AND HE POSTS ALL OF HIS LECTURES ONLINE ANYWAY PEOPLE. He's amazing, super funny and very charismatic. He was actually able to keep me awake during the 8am!!

Armin's quizzes are online, and he gives a good amount of time for you to finish it. If you feel pressured about the time limit, email him, and he might extend the time for you. His midterm was basically like a fourth grade english test- complete the sentence, etc. He offers two extra credits which boosts your grade significantly, about 5%. Easy A.

Armin is probably the nicest LING professor I've had. He is very intelligent and it shows. His accent is amazing. His class is demanding, but not impossible. GO to office hours! Overall, very interesting and amazing class.

Mester is a nice guy, but he just reads off slides and goes waaaaay too fast. I really liked the subject, but his teaching style is not the best... I would avoid taking the class with him if you do need this course.

He's one of the best in the field, the class was very interesting. I didn't do much of the readings but they really would have been helpful. A few quizes were online and the midterm and final were relatively easy. Pretty easy class and definitely interesting. He's very funny! and quite adorable (:

Armin is super enthusiastic and really helpful. His powerpoints are fast, but honestly a lot of it is just examples, so the basic points you can get and then he puts them online for you to look back at. His tests are really fair, but make sure you study! Overall the class is a lot of work and similar to a math class format, but fun!
The class was really interesting and Mester is a nice guy, but his teaching style is not the best. He goes through a powerpoint really fast through one lecture.

I completely disagree with his teaching style, aka zipping through powerpoints & expecting his students to understand the material right away.  I learned more from reading the book during class, which helped with the homeworks. His T/F tests are tough, so beware! He also likes to teach 8am classes, so keep this in mind too!

Armin is a generous grader. Homework problems aren't very difficult, especially if you do the reading. Sometimes the answers for hw are in the book. The class is boring, but not difficult. Concepts are straightforward.

Armin was an ineffective teacher and made the course more difficult than it should have been. He sped through slides and his method of in-class problem solving went by too quickly to enforce the material. That material was on the tests, however, and led to a lot of failing grades because nobody remembered obscure slides. Study guides were useless.

Armin is a great professor.  His accent does not get in the way of his teaching and he knows his material very, very well.  The class itself is not difficult.  I would say it's only as difficult as Phonology 1.  Armin is always available in his office.  The homeworks take time, but are not too difficult.  Start the paper early.  Don't do Latin.

Intro to Linguistics wasn't too hard, but his class was at 8AM!! He's kinda hard to pay attention to that early in the morning because he reads off of his powerpoints, but the class was pretty easy. Just LEARN THE IPA and GO TO DISCUSSION SECTIONS you'll be fine. I wouldn't mind taking another class with him if is wasn't so early in the morning.

WHY does this man insist on 8 a.m. classes and why does he drone on and on without making sure anyone is getting anything, which they aren't because they are all asleep. Worst lecturer ever, and i have to take the next level next quarter and i feel totally unprepared.

a cute funny german man, but didn't really learn very much about phonology. The TA's grade way too hard and only seem to care about how hard their grad school is.I think Mester would grade much easier with clearer comments.
german accent. wittiness. spunk. Armin has it all!

Not nearly as hard as anyone says. My only complaint is that he tends to read from powerpoints a lot, which can become grating at times. Overall he was very helpful and understanding. If there was a problem with that class, it was a couple of the TAs.

Armin is an engaging, excited, and motivating teacher.  Many people had a difficult time with this course, but I didn't find it particularly strenuous.  I highly recommend Armin anytime, I couldn't ask for a more charming, clear, and approachable lecturer.  Always paused for questions in class, was very engaging.  Awesome TA's too.

Nice guy, INCREDIBLY HARD CLASS. took pass/fail and nearly failed. Course moved super fast and material was all supposed to be memorized at a fast pace. Not recommended as a class just for credits or a GE.
He's a nice guy, but the class is soooooo hard. It just moves really quickly.

I really, really like him as a person. Unfortunately, he was a bad teacher. He just went way too fast through lecture (which was just him reading power-points, for the most part) and the reading was dense. The only way I made it was by going to section. It was a trying class overall.

Not exactly hot, but very endearing...if you are not interested in languages and sometimes dry rules, don't take this class as an IH req. If you do, make sure you memorize IPA and you'll do good on the quizzes. Definitely go to section and hope you get the cool TA cause he's hilarious.

this class was horrible. H-O-R-R-I-B-L-E. armin is a very good, animated lecturer but useless outside of class. The grading is ridiculous and section was beyond useless. really really boring class. don't take it unless you HAVE TO.
I really liked having Armin for language change-- it was early in the morning, the textbook sucked, but on the whole, it managed to be a good class that I learned a lot from.  Yay Armin!

Such a good topic..such a lop of a teacher..he is as dry as a peice of stale bread... Anyone who likes him is probably an ass kisser..he is terrible and boring...its like torture without the bonus of death at the end....cross your fingers that you'll pass

Armin rocks.  He's very interested in what he is teaching, so much so that he sometimes gets over-excited and makes funny mistakes, but they are usually caught by a student and we all laugh about it.  Too bad the class was at 8am.  Awesome class though and a great professor.

Oh Hurray I get to be the first to rate Armin! He is very passionate about his teaching, and is a fair grader, as well as his TAs this quarter. He puts every lecture on WebCT and is very concerned about students doing their very best academically. His pace is a bit too fast sometimes, though.
